issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
{{gandiva-decimal_single_test}} is extremely slow on CI builds with Valgrind:
{code}
 99/100 Test #128: gandiva-decimal_single_test ...............   Passed  397.11 sec
100/100 Test #130: gandiva-decimal_single_test_static ........   Passed  338.97 sec
{code}

(full log: https://travis-ci.org/apache/arrow/jobs/480198116#L2707)

Something should be done to make it faster.

comments.body:
Judging by the source code, it seems the JIT compiler is launched anew for each different test input.

cc [~Pindikura Ravindra]

* I can remove the gandiva-decimal_single_test_static, since it's testing the same code.
 * The JIT is different for different precision/scale and so, we need multiple of them. I can re-order/group the tests using the same precision/scale. Or, cache and reuse the JIT.
I think reducing the number of JIT compilations would already be a welcome improvement.
What is the "static" variant of the test supposed to do?

> What is the "static" variant of the test supposed to do?

early on, the static variant used to give some unresolved symbol errors from LLVM. We don't see such issues any longer - we get such errors mostly from java/jni.
gandiva has a cache of JITs to solve these kind of issues. but, there is a bug in the cache lookup.

After the fix,

 

99/99 Test #128: gandiva-decimal_single_test ............... Passed 143.53 sec
